defs.docs:
A rust library for colorizing [`tracing_error::SpanTrace`] objects in the style
 of [`color-backtrace`].

attributes.value: / A rust library for colorizing [`tracing_error::SpanTrace`] objects in the style
/ Setup a tracing subscriber with an `ErrorLayer`:
/ Running `examples/usage.rs` from the `color-spantrace` repo produces the following output:
/ Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.04s

warn(missing_debug_implementations, missing_docs, missing_doc_code_examples,
       rust_2018_idioms, unreachable_pub, bad_style, const_err, dead_code,
       improper_ctypes, non_shorthand_field_patterns, no_mangle_generic_items,
       overflowing_literals, path_statements, patterns_in_fns_without_body,
       private_in_public, unconditional_recursion, unused, unused_allocation,
       unused_comparisons, unused_parens, while_true)

defs.name: Theme
defs.docs: A struct that represents theme that is used by `color_spantrace`

attributes.value: / A struct that represents theme that is used by `color_spantrace`

defs.name: dark
defs.docs: A theme for a dark background. This is the default

attributes.value: / A theme for a dark background. This is the default

defs.name: light
defs.docs: A theme for a light background

attributes.value: / A theme for a light background

defs.name: line_number
defs.docs: Styles the line number of a file

attributes.value: / Styles the line number of a file

defs.name: target
defs.docs: Styles the target (i.e. the module and function name, and so on)

attributes.value: / Styles the target (i.e. the module and function name, and so on)

defs.name: fields
defs.docs: Styles fields associated with a the `tracing::Span`.

attributes.value: / Styles fields associated with a the `tracing::Span`.

defs.name: active_line
defs.docs: Styles the selected line of displayed code

attributes.value: / Styles the selected line of displayed code

defs.name: InstallThemeError
defs.docs: An error returned by `set_theme` if a global theme was already set

attributes.value: / An error returned by `set_theme` if a global theme was already set
/ This can only be set once and otherwise fails.
/ **Note:** `colorize` sets the global theme implicitly, if it was not set already. So calling `colorize` and then `set_theme` fails

defs.name: colorize
defs.docs: Display a [`SpanTrace`] with colors and source

attributes.value: / Display a [`SpanTrace`] with colors and source
/ This function returns an `impl Display` type which can be then used in place of the original
/ SpanTrace when writing it too the screen or buffer.
/ **Note:** `colorize` sets the global theme implicitly, if it was not set already. So calling `colorize` and then `set_theme` fails
